results.title: The Story of Rosy Dock
results.brief_description: The story of an elderly woman who ventures into the central Australian desert to set up her home. In her attempt to recreate the beauty of the home she has left, she does not appreciate the beauty that is already there. Written and designed by author and artist Jeannie Baker, and based on her book of the same name, this animated film uses a unique collage of natural materials. It delivers a powerful message about the seemingly harmless practice of importing foreign flora, and how the Earth’s delicately balanced environment is continually being threatened by human interference. Narrated by Michael Craig. Teachers notes (306347) are available as a separate loan item.

results.title: The Story of Qiu ju = Qiuju da guan si
results.creator_credit: Ma Fung Kwok, Sil-Metropole Organisation, Beijing Film Academy, Youth Film Studio and Chang I-mou
results.brief_description: Set in a small Chinese village, ‘The Story of Qiu Ju’ follows one woman’s crusade to seek justice from the village chief who assaults her husband, Qing Lai, after an argument over Qing’s request to build a shed for drying chilies on prime farming land. Her determination leads her to take on the entire Chinese legal system. A departure from Yimou’s earlier visually sumptuous, period dramas ‘Raise the Red Lantern’ and ‘Ju Dou’, this film adopts a plainer visual style and a satrical tone in observations of contemporary Chinese life and its critique of an overblown and hopelessly ineffective government bureacracy. Based on the novel ‘The Wan Family’s Lawsuit’ by Chen Yuan Bin. Cast includes Gong Li and Lei Que Sheng. In Mandarin with English subtitles.
results.title_for_label: The Story of Qiu ju = Qiuju da guan si

results.title: The Story of prehistoric man
results.brief_description:
Using artefacts, cave paintings and skeletal remains this film describes the life, appearance, habitat and achievements of prehistoric man including the Old and New Stone Ages.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Story of Port Augusta
results.brief_description: A description of the town of Port Augusta in South Australia, giving something of its history, its industries, transport and way of life. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: The Story of paper making
results.creator_credit: Films of Fact and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: The story of paper making from the papyrus of the Egyptians to the machine made product of today. Film closes with scenes of craftsmen making hand-made paper required for artists, draughtsmen, etc.

results.title: The Story of Okra John = L'Histoire d'Okra John
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Roland Pirker, Pierre Stevens and Magnus Einarsson
results.brief_description: Professional storyteller Joan Bodger entertains an audience with a traditional Black folk tale about the tribulations of a slave named Okra John, and how he came to Canada via the “underground railroad.”

results.title: The Story of my life: a film about Hans Andersen
results.creator_credit: Teknisk Film, Dansk Kulturfilm, Jorgen Roos and Erik Witte
results.brief_description: The life of Hans Christian Andersen. The son of a poor cobbler, he becomes Denmark’s national poet. The film reveals the strange childhood from which he derived the whimsy and fantasy of his fairy tales. As a boy of fourteen, he went to Copenhagen, bent on achieving fame in one way or another. He failed to impress the theatrical producers but obtained a scholarship from the King of Denmark. Soon he was writing short stories, plays, poems, novels and fairy tales.
